### Links

Fastqc component, please see https://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/fastqc/. This component can take one or more files (by means of shell globbing) or a complete directory.


## Example commands

You can run the pipeline using `nextflow run`.

### View help

You can use `--help` as a parameter to get an overview of the possible parameters.

```bash
nextflow run czbiohub/utilities \
  -r main_build -latest \
  -main-script target/nextflow/qc/fastqc/main.nf \
  --help
```

### Run command

<details>
<summary>Example of `params.yaml`</summary>
```yaml

```
</details>

```bash
nextflow run czbiohub/utilities \
  -r main_build -latest \
  -profile docker \
  -main-script target/nextflow/qc/fastqc/main.nf \
  -params-file params.yaml
```

:::{.callout-note}
Replace `-profile docker` with `-profile podman` or `-profile singularity` depending on the desired backend.
:::

## Argument group

### Arguments

|Name       |Description                                                        |Attributes                               |
|:----------|:------------------------------------------------------------------|:----------------------------------------|
|`--mode`   |The mode in which the component works. Can be either files or dir. |`string`, default: `"files"`             |
|`--input`  |Directory containing input fastq files.                            |`file`, required, example: `"fastq_dir"` |
|`--output` |Output directory to write reports to.                              |`file`, required, example: `"qc"`        |
